TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company lodged a claim for payment of MONEY ( ORG ) ( LAW ) against a company NORP with ORG . The case was to be examined by way of a summary procedure .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company filed a motion for exemption from court fees . It argued that its revenue in DATE had decreased significantly and that it had had to pay overdue taxes and debts to its creditors . The applicant company further indicated that it did not own any property of significant value . On DATE it submitted to the court its financial report for DATE , tax declarations ORG for DATE and PERSON for DATE , its bank account statements and information concerning its property and the number of employees .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the application for exemption . It found that the applicant company had generated substantial gross income ( przychód ) in DATE ( ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL ) and DATE ( ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL ) and would be able to pay ORG CARDINAL in court fees .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant company appealed . It submitted that on CARDINAL DATE it had filed a motion for insolvency . However , the motion had been rejected because the company had insufficient assets to cover the costs of the insolvency procedure .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal . It underlined that the documents produced by the applicant company indicated that from DATE it had spent the amount of MONEY and it had still possessed cash in its cash desk . The court also stressed that commercial entities should have set aside the resources necessary to fund potential litigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant company to pay a further LAW ( LAW ) in supplementary court fees .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company filed an application for exemption from supplementary court fees . It submitted copies of the following documents concerning its financial situation : a financial report for DATE , a tax declaration PERSON for DATE , bank account statements , VAT-CARDINAL declaration for DATE , cash reports for DATE and information on its property and the number of employees .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the application for exemption . It found on the basis of the documentary evidence that from DATE to CARDINAL DATE the applicant company had generated ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL in gross income . The court noted that the applicant company had sustained a loss , but that that was not a sufficient ground to exempt it from court fees . It emphasised that as the applicant company had carried out commercial activity on a large scale , it should have earmarked funds for litigation purposes . On DATE the applicant company appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed its appeal , concurring with the reasons given by ORG . It found that in DATE the applicant company had generated gross income and had possessed enough funds to pay court fees . ORG underlined that the applicant company had not demonstrated that it had been in a difficult financial situation ; on the contrary , in its appeal it admitted to having funds to pay its debts to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company paid ORG MONEY in court fees .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave judgment . It dismissed the applicant ’s company claim against the company NORP on the grounds that the relevant limitation period had expired .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company lodged an appeal against ORG judgment . On DATE it applied for exemption from court fees for pursuing its appeal in the amount of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) . The applicant company submitted that the current state of its accounts had proved its disastrous financial situation .

CARDINAL . NORP ORG instructed the applicant company to submit , on pain of dismissal of its motion , copies of the following documents : the financial report for the period from DATE to DATE , the tax declaration CIT-CARDINAL for DATE , the tax declaration PERSON for the period from DATE to CARDINAL DATE , information about all bank accounts of the applicant company and extracts thereof , information on all transactions made on each account within DATE , tax declaration VAT-CARDINAL for the period from DATE to CARDINAL DATE and information on its property and the number of employees .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company submitted the following declarations : tax declaration PERSON for the requested period , declaration PERSON for DATE , extract from a bank account of CARDINAL DATE and a declaration of ORG in Wyszków of DATE . It also stated that it did not own any real property .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the application for exemption . It found that the applicant company had failed to substantiate its assertion that it had been unable to pay the court fees . It noted that the applicant company had failed to submit all requested documents concerning its financial standing . The court stressed that the applicant company had still carried out its commercial activity on a large scale and that in the period DATE and DATE it had generated a significant gross income in the amount of ORG MONEY ( ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . NORP Moreover , the court noted that the applicant company had produced only the cash report for DATE ( DATE ) despite the court ’s request to submit all reports for the period DATE and DATE . In the court ’s view , that failure might indicate the applicant company ’s intention to hide profits that had been actually made . The court had also regard to the declaration of ORG that for DATE of time there had been no financial operations on the applicant company ’s bank account . In this connection , the court found that the applicant company must have carried out its financial operations in cash since it had been obliged to keep a record of all income and expenses . The court underlined that a commercial entity should not claim that the refusal to exempt it from payment of court fees had constituted a limitation of its rights when it had not earmarked any funds for potential litigation and had carried out its financial operations in such a manner as to avoid the payment of court fees .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company appealed . It argued that the losses in the relevant period had exceeded the company ’s gross income and pointed to a significant debt owed to the tax office .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal . The court found that the applicant company had incurred substantial costs and expenses exceeding its generated gross income , which showed that it had not been properly managed . It also found that since the beginning of the proceedings the applicant company should have put aside money for the costs of future proceedings as it had been still carrying out its commercial activity .

ORG noted that the applicant company had failed to produce all the requested documents ( inter alia , the financial report for the period from DATE to DATE and the VAT-CARDINAL declaration for the relevant period ) . In this connection , it stressed that it was impossible to evaluate the financial situation of the applicant company . Furthermore , the cash report concerned DATE only ( DATE ) , while ORG had specifically requested a report for the period DATE and DATE . In respect of the declaration of ORG , the court noted that the company must have carried out its operations in cash or have had accounts in other banks .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant company ’s appeal against the first - instance judgment of CARDINAL DATE for failure to pay court fees required for proceeding with its appeal .

On DATE and DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s company ’s requests to institute insolvency proceedings because its assets had been considered insufficient to cover the costs of proceedings , not to mention the debts that the company had accumulated . In the most recent of these decisions the court established that the applicant company had owed money to CARDINAL companies and the tax office . The liabilities due from its creditors were unenforceable in spite of several sets of proceedings instituted by the applicant company . The company ’s assets deposited in its bank account amounted to PLN CARDINAL,CARDINAL ; in addition , the company owned old forms for production of vacuum cleaners worth a total amount of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL . In sum , the court considered that the applicant company would not be able to satisfy any of its debtors ; thus , the insolvency proceedings would be devoid of purpose .
